document.masterDocTitle: The cicadas (Hemiptera: Cicadidae) of Bolivia including the descriptions of fifteen new species, the resurrection of one genus and two species, seven new combinations, six new synonymies, and twenty-eight new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The cicadas (Hemiptera: Cicadidae) of Bolivia including the descriptions of fifteen new species, the resurrection of one genus and two species, seven new combinations, six new synonymies, and twenty-eight new records

subSubSection.paragraph:
REMARKS. This is the largest of the Bolivian species of
Proarna
with some females reaching body lengths of 31 mm or more. The costal margin is unique in for the Bolivian species of
Proarna
in that it is curved rather than straight from the base. The size of the species combined with the curved costal margin make the species fairly easy to distinguish.
DISTRIBUTION. The species has been reported from Colombia , Ecuador , Peru , and South America ( Metcalf 1963a ; Sanborn 2013 ).

MATERIAL EXAMINED FOR
NEW RECORD . “ BOLIVIA : Prov. Andrés Ibáñez / Dept. de Santa Cruz ,
1,369 ft.
/ Potrerillos del Guenda / W. of Santa Cruz // Dec. 13/15 , 2009 at MV & BL / S-17.67089º/W-63.45761º / N.J. Smith , A.J. Gilbert , & / J. Aramayo Bejarano ” one male ( UCDC )
